14#ifndef NS_QUERY_H
15#define NS_QUERY_H 1
16
17/*! \file */
18
19#include <stdbool.h>
20
21#include <isc/types.h>
22#include <isc/buffer.h>
23#include <isc/netaddr.h>
24
25#include <dns/rdataset.h>
26#include <dns/resolver.h>
27#include <dns/rpz.h>
28#include <dns/types.h>
29
30#include <ns/types.h>
31
32/*% nameserver database version structure */
33typedef struct ns_dbversion {
34 dns_db_t *db;
35 dns_dbversion_t *version;
36 bool acl_checked;
37 bool queryok;
38 ISC_LINK(struct ns_dbversion) link;
39} ns_dbversion_t;
40
41/*%
42 * nameserver recursion parameters, to uniquely identify a recursion
43 * query; this is used to detect a recursion loop
44 */
45typedef struct ns_query_recparam {
46 dns_rdatatype_t qtype;
47 dns_name_t * qname;
48 dns_fixedname_t fqname;
49 dns_name_t * qdomain;
50 dns_fixedname_t fqdomain;
51} ns_query_recparam_t;
52
53/*% nameserver query structure */
54struct ns_query {
55 unsigned int attributes;
56 unsigned int restarts;
57 bool timerset;
58 dns_name_t * qname;
59 dns_name_t * origqname;
60 dns_rdatatype_t qtype;
61 unsigned int dboptions;
62 unsigned int fetchoptions;
63 dns_db_t * gluedb;
64 dns_db_t * authdb;
65 dns_zone_t * authzone;
66 bool authdbset;
67 bool isreferral;
68 isc_mutex_t fetchlock;
69 dns_fetch_t * fetch;
70 dns_fetch_t * prefetch;
71 dns_rpz_st_t * rpz_st;
72 isc_bufferlist_t namebufs;
73 ISC_LIST(ns_dbversion_t) activeversions;
74 ISC_LIST(ns_dbversion_t) freeversions;
75 dns_rdataset_t * dns64_aaaa;
76 dns_rdataset_t * dns64_sigaaaa;
77 bool * dns64_aaaaok;
78 unsigned int dns64_aaaaoklen;
79 unsigned int dns64_options;
80 unsigned int dns64_ttl;
81
82 struct {
83 dns_db_t * db;
84 dns_zone_t * zone;
85 dns_dbnode_t * node;
86 dns_rdatatype_t qtype;
87 dns_name_t * fname;
88 dns_fixedname_t fixed;
89 isc_result_t result;
90 dns_rdataset_t * rdataset;
91 dns_rdataset_t * sigrdataset;
92 bool authoritative;
93 bool is_zone;
94 } redirect;
95
96 ns_query_recparam_t recparam;
97
98 dns_keytag_t root_key_sentinel_keyid;
99 bool root_key_sentinel_is_ta;
100 bool root_key_sentinel_not_ta;
101};
102
103#define NS_QUERYATTR_RECURSIONOK 0x00001
104#define NS_QUERYATTR_CACHEOK 0x00002
105#define NS_QUERYATTR_PARTIALANSWER 0x00004
106#define NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED 0x00008
107#define NS_QUERYATTR_RECURSING 0x00010
108#define NS_QUERYATTR_QUERYOKVALID 0x00040
109#define NS_QUERYATTR_QUERYOK 0x00080
110#define NS_QUERYATTR_WANTRECURSION 0x00100
111#define NS_QUERYATTR_SECURE 0x00200
112#define NS_QUERYATTR_NOAUTHORITY 0x00400
113#define NS_QUERYATTR_NOADDITIONAL 0x00800
114#define NS_QUERYATTR_CACHEACLOKVALID 0x01000
115#define NS_QUERYATTR_CACHEACLOK 0x02000
116#define NS_QUERYATTR_DNS64 0x04000
117#define NS_QUERYATTR_DNS64EXCLUDE 0x08000
118#define NS_QUERYATTR_RRL_CHECKED 0x10000
119#define NS_QUERYATTR_REDIRECT 0x20000
120
121typedef struct query_ctx query_ctx_t;
122
123/* query context structure */
124struct query_ctx {
125 isc_buffer_t *dbuf; /* name buffer */
126 dns_name_t *fname; /* found name from DB lookup */
127 dns_name_t *tname; /* temporary name, used
128 * when processing ANY
129 * queries */
130 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset; /* found rdataset */
131 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset; /* found sigrdataset */
132 dns_rdataset_t *noqname; /* rdataset needing
133 * NOQNAME proof */
134 dns_rdatatype_t qtype;
135 dns_rdatatype_t type;
136
137 unsigned int options; /* DB lookup options */
138
139 bool redirected; /* nxdomain redirected? */
140 bool is_zone; /* is DB a zone DB? */
141 bool is_staticstub_zone;
142 bool resuming; /* resumed from recursion? */
143 bool dns64, dns64_exclude, rpz;
144 bool authoritative; /* authoritative query? */
145 bool want_restart; /* CNAME chain or other
146 * restart needed */
147 bool need_wildcardproof; /* wilcard proof needed */
148 bool nxrewrite; /* negative answer from RPZ */
149 bool findcoveringnsec; /* lookup covering NSEC */
150 bool answer_has_ns; /* NS is in answer */
151 dns_fixedname_t wildcardname; /* name needing wcard proof */
152 dns_fixedname_t dsname; /* name needing DS */
153
154 ns_client_t *client; /* client object */
155 bool detach_client; /* client needs detaching */
156
157 dns_fetchevent_t *event; /* recursion event */
158
159 dns_db_t *db; /* zone or cache database */
160 dns_dbversion_t *version; /* DB version */
161 dns_dbnode_t *node; /* DB node */
162
163 dns_db_t *zdb; /* zone DB values, saved */
164 dns_dbnode_t *znode; /* while searching cache */
165 dns_name_t *zfname; /* for a better answer */
166 dns_dbversion_t *zversion;
167 dns_rdataset_t *zrdataset;
168 dns_rdataset_t *zsigrdataset;
169
170 dns_rpz_st_t *rpz_st; /* RPZ state */
171 dns_zone_t *zone; /* zone to search */
172
173 dns_view_t *view; /* client view */
174
175 isc_result_t result; /* query result */
176 int line; /* line to report error */
177};
178
179/*
180 * The following functions are expected to be used only within query.c
181 * and query modules.
182 */
183
184isc_result_t
185ns_query_done(query_ctx_t *qctx);
186/*%<
187 * Finalize this phase of the query process:
188 *
189 * - Clean up.
190 * - If we have an answer ready (positive or negative), send it.
191 * - If we need to restart for a chaining query, call ns__query_start() again.
192 * - If we've started recursion, then just clean up; things will be
193 * restarted via fetch_callback()/query_resume().
194 */
195
196isc_result_t
197ns_query_recurse(ns_client_t *client, dns_rdatatype_t qtype, dns_name_t *qname,
198 dns_name_t *qdomain, dns_rdataset_t *nameservers,
199 bool resuming);
200/*%<
201 * Prepare client for recursion, then create a resolver fetch, with
202 * the event callback set to fetch_callback(). Afterward we terminate
203 * this phase of the query, and resume with a new query context when
204 * recursion completes.
205 */
206
207
208isc_result_t
209ns_query_init(ns_client_t *client);
210
211void
212ns_query_free(ns_client_t *client);
213
214void
215ns_query_start(ns_client_t *client);
216
217void
218ns_query_cancel(ns_client_t *client);
219
220/*
221 * The following functions are expected to be used only within query.c
222 * and query modules.
223 */
224
225isc_result_t
226ns_query_done(query_ctx_t *qctx);
227/*%<
228 * Finalize this phase of the query process:
229 *
230 * - Clean up.
231 * - If we have an answer ready (positive or negative), send it.
232 * - If we need to restart for a chaining query, call ns__query_start() again.
233 * - If we've started recursion, then just clean up; things will be
234 * restarted via fetch_callback()/query_resume().
235 */
236
237isc_result_t
238ns_query_recurse(ns_client_t *client, dns_rdatatype_t qtype, dns_name_t *qname,
239 dns_name_t *qdomain, dns_rdataset_t *nameservers,
240 bool resuming);
241/*%<
242 * Prepare client for recursion, then create a resolver fetch, with
243 * the event callback set to fetch_callback(). Afterward we terminate
244 * this phase of the query, and resume with a new query context when
245 * recursion completes.
246 */
247
248
249isc_result_t
250ns__query_sfcache(query_ctx_t *qctx);
251/*%<
252 * (Must not be used outside this module and its associated unit tests.)
253 */
254
255isc_result_t
256ns__query_start(query_ctx_t *qctx);
257/*%<
258 * (Must not be used outside this module and its associated unit tests.)
259 */
260
261#endif /* NS_QUERY_H */
